item.title: catherine add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: catherine add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "I no longer believed in the idea of soul mates, or love at first sight. But I was beginning to believe that a very few times in your life, if you were lucky, you might meet someone who was exactly right for you. Not because he was perfect, or because you were, but because your combined flaws were arranged in a way that allowed two separate beings to hinge together." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: catherine add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "My real self wanders elsewhere, far away, wanders on and on invisibly and has nothing to do with my life." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: catherine add a quote by Alfred Sutro
item.description: "That's the penalty we have to pay for our acts of foolishness - someone else always suffers for them." -- Alfred Sutro

item.title: catherine add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: catherine add a quote by Lauren Oliver
item.description: "I love you. Remember. They cannot take it" -- Lauren Oliver

item.title: catherine add a quote by William Osler
item.description: "Think not of the amount to be accomplished, the difficulties to be overcome, or the end to be attained, but set earnestly, at the little task at your elbow, letting that be sufficient for the day." -- William Osler

item.title: catherine add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Try to love the questions themselves as if they were locked rooms or books written in a very foreign language. Don't search for the answers, which could not be given to you now, because you would not be able to live with them. And the point is to live everything. Live the questions now." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: catherine add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Everything in the world of things and animals is still filled with happening, which you can take part in." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: catherine add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps then, some day far in the future, you will gradually, without even noticing it, live your way into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: catherine add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: catherine add a quote by Stephen Crane
item.description: "Held his heart in his hands, And ate of it. I said: "Is it good, friend?" "It is bitter - bitter," he answered; "But I like it Because it is bitter, And because it is my heart." -- Stephen Crane

item.title: catherine add a quote by Jenna Petersen
item.description: "The past is unchangeable, but the future is unwritten." -- Jenna Petersen

item.title: catherine add a quote by Susane Colasanti
item.description: "That's the tricky thing about being bonded to someone for life. Blake and his dad are bonded like I'm bonded with Erin. We're irrevocably tied together by history, a history that can never be erased. Even if you want to deny it, even it you want to pretend it never existed, it will always be a part of you. It will always, in some way, define who you are." -- Susane Colasanti

item.title: catherine add a quote by Susane Colasanti
item.description: "We know each other in a way that no one else can. We share a history that makes us permanently connected." -- Susane Colasanti

item.title: catherine add a quote by Susane Colasanti
item.description: "All I can do is hope." -- Susane Colasanti

item.title: catherine add a quote by Walter Lipman
item.description: "When all men think alike, no one thinks very much." -- Walter Lipman

item.title: catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The secret to getting ahead is getting started." -- Mark Twain

item.title: catherine add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Close the door. Write with no one looking over your shoulder. Don't try to figure out what other people want to hear from you; figure out what you have to say. It's the one and only thing you have to offer." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: catherine add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence." -- Aristotle

item.title: catherine add a quote by Anne Bronte
item.description: "But he who dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose." -- Anne Bronte

item.title: catherine add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "The comfort of the rich depends upon an abundant supply of the poor." -- Voltaire

item.title: catherine add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "Sometimes a woman needs a man for company, no matter how useless he is." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: catherine add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "Imagination is the golden-eyed monster that never sleeps. It must be fed; it cannot be ignored." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: catherine add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books." -- Jo Walton

item.title: catherine add a quote by Gabrielle Zevin
item.description: "On, there are so many lives. How we wish we could live them concurrently instead of one by one by one. We could select the best pieces of each, stringing them together like a strand of pearls. But that's not how it works. A human life is a beautiful mess." -- Gabrielle Zevin

item.title: catherine add a quote by Gayle Forman
item.description: "I realize now that dying is easy. Living is hard." -- Gayle Forman

item.title: catherine add a quote by Natalie Babbitt
item.description: "You can't have living without dying. So you can't call it living, what we got. We just are, we just be, like rocks beside the road." -- Natalie Babbitt

item.title: catherine add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "Next day, as the Ferris wheel was being taken apart and the race horses were being loaded into vans and the entertainers were packing up their belongings and driving away in their trailers, Charlotte died. The Fair Grounds were soon deserted. The sheds and buildings were empty and forlorn. The infield was littered with bottles and trash. Nobody, of the hundreds of people that had visited the Fair, knew that a grey spider had played the most important part of all. No one was with her when she died." -- E.B. White

item.title: catherine add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire
